What is xTool?
xTool is part of Makeblock, a world-renowned coding robot manufacturer & education solution provider. Our brand’s story started with a lot of love and a little inspiration (“How can we make it easier and safer for kids to enjoy creating?”). The brand concept of xTool was born in 2018 and we launched the first xTool LaserBox in 2019. From there, our mission has been to help people turn their creativity into reality (and have fun doing it)!





We are also proud of our industrial design and have won numerous awards.





We do not brag about ourselves but enjoy a word-of-mouth reputation.

















We were named one of  ProductHype's  Best Kickstarter Projects of 2021.

record.Creator: Clemens
record.Title: The Solar System in a Sphere - True to Scale
record.Text:
Beautiful 3-Dimensional glass arts with scientific background since 2016
Most pictures are real photos

Get in touch with the magnitudes of the Universe: learn about the Universe, Galaxy, Star Constellations, Microbes, Viruses, and Human development through our previous campaigns 
Colorful lighting and brilliant look with our new LED Base 
 Now the Solar System will be shown in a unique and most precise way 
 Cross-promotion with Space Boardgame of a former coworker at the very end! 




Photo: Solar System Prototype II





Photo: Planet Cubes Prototypes + Solar System Sphere Prototype II + New LED Base





Photo: Milky Way, Universe and Solar System Prototype I + New LED Base





Rendering of our 9 Planet Cube Set





Rendering: Sphere with regular LED Base





Rendering: Big Sphere with big LED Base































Within the past years, we inspired over 10.000 people with our educational glass art.





Photo: Microcosm Products





Photo: Big Sphere with Cat







Another representation of our Solar System? There are hundreds of books/websites about it and everybody knows our 9 planets and how they are arranged, right? After all, we should have learned that in school...





Many of us still remember the mnemonic: 
"My Very Educated Mother Just Served Us Nine Pizzas" or as we say here in Germany: "Mein Vater Erklärt Mir Jeden Sonntag Unsere Neun Planeten".   
With this help, many of us can at least list the planets correctly...
Mars, Venus, Earth, Mercury, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune, Pluto, right? Almost! Pluto was assumed to be a planet but does not identify itself as such anymore and Mercury comes before Mars,  but the most crucial fact is:

That most of us never understood the true differences in size and distances between the planets, because most representations are not true to scale.





With a strong laser, we shoot tiny cracks into the glass. We laser our Sun + 9 Planets: Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Neptune, Uranus, and the hypothetical Planet 9 into our famous Spheres. We also want to picture the 9 Moons: Ganymede, Callisto, Io, Europa, Rhea, Titan, Iapetus, Triton, and our Moon Moon (Luna).



Photo: Prototype II Solar System Sphere + New LED Base





Photo: Sun, Earth, and Moon in our Solar System Prototype II





Photo: Jupiter and Saturn with moons


The Sun in our Sphere will be 4cm, the largest Planet 4mm, and the smallest Moon 0.1mm, which is barely visible to the naked eye and even more difficult for our camera.








Rendering


Not everyone might be a fan of our scaled representation of the Solar System, so we consider offering different versions of it











 We also want to offer a 9 Planet Cube Set, containing a planet each with a size of 3x3x3cm.



Rendering: Planet Cubes



You can try to place these small cubes at the right distances to the Solar Sphere, but this might be more difficult than thought. Why?



Photo: Micro Cube Prototype I


Because although they are so small in our Sphere you can barely see Earth, they would be ridiculously far away. There is probably no one in the world who could throw our Neptune regarding our Sphere onto its Orbit.  Even Saturn is challenging but doable. Challenge accepted? 



Please don´t throw your cubes, they are hard to find, breakable, and might hurt like hell.















Rendering


After what felt like eons of searching for a good LED base that is stylish, functional, and affordable, we finally found one. Of course, the bases we've offered so far work flawlessly and even wirelessly, but they lack some features and don't completely light up our models the way I want them to.








Photo/Gif: Spheres + New LED Base





Photo: Prototypes Planet cubes + Prototype II Solar Sphere + New LED Base





Photo: 9-Set Earthling + Earthling in a Sphere Week 12 + New LED Base


With the new LED bar, our spheres and small cubes can be illuminated perfectly. You can control it via smartphone and create your own color schemes. You can even pair the LED with any TV so that the colors match the TV program. 



Photo/Gif


 I am very delighted.





As in our previous campaigns, we would like to present many interesting facts about our models in our updates. Maybe we will also make a small booklet again.
For example: Did you know that the ice giants Neptune and Uranus are not cold at all? The atmosphere consists of a hydrogen-methane mixture that becomes a hot fluid due to the enormous pressure. Further inside, phenomena like hail and even whole icebergs of Diamonds are suspected. But then why are they called ice giants?  
Find out in our updates!





But we also want to write about the habitable zones, the moons, and the immense distance the planets are apart.



Overview: Solar System


Within the campaign, we will explain the differences between our planned models and the different shapes and sizes of our products.



Rendering: Size comparison regular Sphere





Rendering: regular Sphere, big Sphere, Planet Cubes






Rendering: Planet Cubes







 Even though our Star Constellation Sphere with its 5068 stars and 88 constellations already fits really nicely into the series...



Photo: Star Constellations Sphere 3D



...the Solar System Sphere with its Sun, Planets, and Moons truly completes our Universe Sphere series. Thus, the individual lasered points symbolize either planets or Moons, Stars, or entire Galaxies, depending on the Sphere.





















We will design Solar System Coasters and hand them out to our first 1000 backers for free. There will be a set of 2x10 coasters - Our Sun + 9 Planets,  so you can also play memory.  We got some more ideas, so stay tuned!










All products can also be added and purchased via our add-on store, such as old and new products, LED Bases, and the Early Bird Planet Coasters. 















In campaigns from other creators, we have seen that shipping fees are often collected after the campaign. This has several advantages for you and us and therefore we decided to do the same. 

But don't worry, because of the many previous campaigns we made, we can estimate the maximum costs very well, so there are no nasty surprises waiting for you.
Advantages: 

We can renegotiate the shipping cost when we create a large order.
We can calculate the shipping costs more fair if you order add-ons (there were some difficulties with that in the past)
We can save a part of the Kickstarter fee, which is normally also deducted from the shipping costs. But since we don't make any profit on the shipping costs, we find that fair enough. and can save you some money at best.






Meanwhile, we have a professional fulfillment partner, but in the beginning, I still packed 4000 packages by hand with my father and my brother. 






You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.





Play

































Replay with sound









Play with  sound












00:00


00:00









































It all started with me, Clemens, and my wedding actually. I had just graduated as a mechanical engineer when I pitched the idea of my Universe Sphere on Kickstarter to earn some money for my wedding. The campaign was a complete success and motivated me to design more such models. From this, the company CinkS labs was born and meanwhile, we have a couple of employees who support me with my projects.





Our first priority is our scientific approach. We´re conducting adequate research, we enlist the help of relevant scientists and try to figure out what will work best for our glass pieces. For the planets as an example, the difficulty is to not just laser a white ball into the glass but to make the structure visible.

We design and model our 3D images to laser-etch them into the glass with the highest precision. You can hardly see the microscopic dots with the naked eye. 
The dots are in fact not air bubbles, as many people think, but tiny cracks that reflect light differently at varying angles due to their elongated shape. These are created by heat pulses emitted by a focused laser several thousand times per second.
We made a short video of our laser process for a previous campaign, "The Microcosm in a Sphere".






You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.





Play

































Replay with sound









Play with  sound












00:00


00:00





































Unfortunately, we do have copycats, but with stark differences in quality.
Our original Spheres offer solid optical grade glass with high resolution, scientifically accurate models and are available in 8cm as well as an unreached above average size of 15cm.  Made in - and shipped from Germany.











This timeline represents something like the bad case. We know that worldwide shipments have been and will continue to be severely delayed due to various circumstances (Covid, Evergreen, Christmas etc.), thus we would rather make a conservative estimate so that you will be pleasantly surprised if we deliver sooner rather than disappointed if your spheres won't arrive in a couple of months.









Gallery


 2021/11/08



Photo: Prototypes Planet Cubes





Photo: Prototypes Planet Cubes





Photo: Spheres


 2021/11/01



Rendering: Solar System Sphere + Planet Cubes










Rendering Planet Cubes





Rendering: regular Sphere, big Sphere, Planet Cubes





Photo: Solar System Prototype II 





Photo: Milky Way, Universe, Star Constellations 3D + New LED Base










Photo: Solar System Prototype II





Photo: Big Milky Way Sphere with Big LED Base





























We are proud to support a former employee. He is starting his own journey soon, with the board game he worked on for four years now together with a friend: 
AUREA - Legacy of the Yatary.  It´s a race for the resources of an entire Galaxy. Diplomacy, Trade, Research, War...how will you play, how will you shine and how will you perish? Join his campaign and find out. 







We want to add a game segment to every order. Keep it to support the campaign and get a discount... or use it as a glass coaster, it´s up to you. But most important:
Follow them: 
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/strgaltentf/aurea-legacy-of-the-yatary
More Infos:
https://www.huginn-muninn.games/

record.Creator: TR Life Style
record.Title: M-9: World’s First Dome-Shaped Ergonomic Nose Hair Trimmer
record.Text:
Over 85 million Americans use electric/battery-powered razors, and the US market size for razors is up to 4 billion dollars. These numbers are reflected as people started to gain interest in taking care of their outer looks, accelerating the growth of the men's grooming market. This phenomenon will grow the demands for shaving products and the whole men's grooming market in general. And the beauty industry, like these, will focus more on the detailing section of men's beauty. Amongst all the possible products, nose hair trimming is one of them.





People seldomly use nose hair trimmers instead of using their hands, scissors, or wax to take care of their nose hair. But they do not seem to satisfy the user's expectations most of the time. Instead of actually trimming your nose hair, plucking is not going to fill your needs anymore. And nonetheless, plucking your nose hair is very dangerous.





There may be times where the sharp blades might poke and scratch the inside of your nose. Experts warn the public that nose hair plucking is quite dangerous. The assistant professor for ENT at the Columbia University Medical Center, Jason A Moche, stated that since the human nose sucks in dust every day in a vacuum, plucking one's nose hair might put the individual at risk of infection.



"GQ", https://www.gq.com/story/nose-hair-trimmer-grooming-ask-an-expert


An individual might look very appealing Just by keeping yourself clean and calm. With M-9's light, portable, simple, and curvy dome-shaped design, users are free from the threat of hurting themselves due to the absence of a mirror. The world's first ergonomically designed dome-shaped design will keep you safe and slick. Meet the innovative nose hair trimmer M-9 that will make you the gentlemen you dream of.























3rd Planet Techies






MR GADGET


ㅤ








 ㅤ





We all have hurt the inside of our nose trying to pluck out our nose hair with sharp scissors or tweezers.  But they do not really get the job done and hurt our nose badly.





The M-9 was designed with ergonomics and safety in mind with its dome-shaped structure, making the blades invisible externally. With its soft curved line finish, the users will not feel uncomfortable, and they will also be free from the threats of a sharp blade. Also, by coating the dome-shaped nets with nickel, it is upgraded to ensure our user's safety and sanitation.















The dome-shaped structure brings another level of safety by preventing the blades from making direct contact with any parts of our body. Also, since it was designed with a dome shape, it prevents the users from accidentally sticking the device deeply inside their noses. (Providing a more comfortable shaving/trimming experience)





The dome-shaped heads and their blades provide a super high precision cutting, drastically decreasing the chances of pinching or scratching the skin. Also, since it is made with stainless steel, the M-9 is extraordinarily durable and economical, with no need for frequent replacements to be made.







When removing nose hair, the highest priority is how fast and precisely you can remove them.





The M-9 is upgraded with the 8700 RPM motor from the 7100 RPM Motor from M-7(our previous model). With this upgrade, the M-9 is equipped with the most powerful motor, providing a more delicate and precise trimming with a high-speed centrifugal cut.















M-9 is only 12.5X2.5X2.5cm and 54g big. Due to its lightweight and size that would perfectly fit in our palms, the M-9 is way lighter than other electric shavers. The M-9 also comes with its own carrying case, enabling users to carry it around to keep their fresh looks.





Also, there is no need for extra charging. A AA battery is good enough to provide power for prolong usage. It will take care of your hair with just a touch of a button















Grooming is needed for every part of your body. The M-9's usage is not only limited to nose hair but, it can also be used for ears, mustache, eyebrows, and sideburns. If you have that cool mustache then, design it with more precision. They can all be done without expert help if you have M-9.










As this is a product that is inserted in our nose, we took extra precautions on sanitation. The M-9 is splash-proof, and it can be cleaned by just rinsing it with water. After shaving, just simply insert the head of the device, and it will clean automatically.




















If you would like to really deep clean your M-9, use the cleaning brush provided with the package. Now, you are ready to keep your blades clean and sanitary, 24/7.










Unlike other ordinary nose hair trimmers that are just round in shape, the M-9 is round with straight and edged lines. These were done to provide a better grip with an ergonomic design. With this unique design, the M-9 will not roll over your countertop. (Or it can even be kept standing up)





By selecting non-glare black plastic, the M-9 has a modern and minimalistic look. The M-9 is the ultimately designed shaver for you.















* Warning: When rinsing the device after disassembling the dome-head, be cautious as the blade might slip out.























































With our experience and technology in developing beauty appliances, we developed our own nose hair trimmer. We did not settle on just a single development, but we came up with a much safer and sanitary nose hair trimmer based on our customer's feedback and technological improvements.

Please check 2 things before contacting customer service. The device might not be functioning due to a dead battery. Please replace the battery and recheck if the device would turn on. Also, try running the device without the dome-shaped nets. If the dome-shaped net is damaged, the blades might get stuck on the net and stop running. In this case, the dome-shaped nets can be replaced separately, and the device will be good to go.

record.Creator: SPEEDIANCE
record.Title: Speediance: Personal All-In-One Home Gym & Workout Coach
record.Text:
Speediance is an all-in-one AI-powered home gym with four power modes, 21.5-inch touch screen, and smart accessories to target different muscle groups. This space-saving, foldable home gym eliminates costly, bulky equipment and helps you efficiently achieve your fitness goals!






















Thank you for all the support you've been giving us! We are upgrading the subscription from 3-year free to Lifetime FREE for all Kickstarter backers!!!




























You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.





Play

































Replay with sound









Play with  sound












00:00


00:00































We randomly invited people in a gym to try our product.
























No installation or wall mounting is required, Speediance is ready to use right out of the box. Its compact, foldable design takes up only 3.2 ft² when folded and not in use. This space-saving design fits in any home for fast, effective workouts.















A full set of smart accessories allow you to get a full-body workout without the hassle of changing machines. Simply add the preferred accessory to target specific muscle groups.










With Speediance, you can lift up to 220 pounds of digital weights and the weight can be easily adjusted in 1 pound increments to optimize resistance for different exercises.





Looking for a new total-body fitness routine? Try a workout which exercises up to 86% of your muscles at once. Speediance has a specially designed NEW accessory for you! You don't have to be a competitive athlete to reap the benefits of rowing. Thanks to the rowing bench accessory, Speediance can easily transform into a rowing machine for the ultimate workout.










Speediance is a money saving solution to home fitness that combines the effects of multiple workout machines into one compact easy to use design.












Speediance is not limited to strength training. The system includes a variety of workout programs developed by experts including shaping, weight loss, yoga, stretching and more for specialized full-body fitness. Find the program that works best for you.

















To help you optimize your training plan, Speediance automatically tracks every rep, set, range of motion, power and time under tension. You can track the data in real time and see your progress and the results of your workouts at a glance.












Speediance intelligently records and analyzes your exercise performance and recommends training tips and workout programs led by experts to help you meet your fitness goals more efficiently and scientifically. Save time and get in shape faster!











Say goodbye to sports injuries! Our patented Spotter Mode will automatically reduce the weight resistance when it detects that you reach your limit. This safety feature can prevent serious injury and is perfect for working out alone.











Speediance cares for each member of your family. Switch between different accounts to access personal training records, tips, courses and exercise programs for different family members or other people in the household.












Noise complaints from your neighbors caused by free weights hitting the ground or noisy exercise machines are a thing of the past. Speediance knows how to keep the noise down.


















































































The story starts with a retrofitted hub motor solution and a group of youngsters who want to use the power of technology to help everyone keep fit and healthy. To realize this goal, we have gathered fitness, hardware, and software experts with years of experience in the industry. Our mission is to create a way for people to get fit at home without going to the gym or investing in expensive and redundant exercise gear. Instead, people can start strength training in a simple and effective way at home whenever they choose with our innovative all-in-one fitness solution.





After four iterations and countless hours of testing and optimization, we have achieved success. We proudly present to you the final result of our efforts, the Speediance Gym Monster. Thank you for your support.





 Early Concept Drawings of the Speediance All-In-One Fitness System





 Earlier versions of the Speediance All-In-One Fitness System

record.Creator: Oliver New
record.Title: Pinsta Instant Camera - Micro Darkroom and Negative Enlarger
record.Text:
Pinsta camera features












Pinsta is a camera which can shoot directly onto positive 4x5 inch photographic paper. It develops internally, and can be used on the go, wherever you are and whenever you like for creating and sharing real analogue prints!



A photo taken with Pinsta onto Harman direct positive paper, exposure time 4 minutes



Makes analogue photography available to everyone
Transfer paper or negatives from your existing large format camera for on site developing
Lets you print analogue photos wherever you are and whenever you like
Be sure that you have a good shot before you move on
Enlarge your own 35mm, 6x45 and 6x6 negatives without the need for a darkroom
Lets you be creative like never before with Pinsta's internal slide system
Preserve, engage in and show people the magic of analogue photography
Learn more about traditional processes
Perfect for education and photography workshops
Thoughtfully made Pinsta prints make wonderful presents for friends and family


 Pinsta is also a mini-enlarger! For those already shooting film and wanting to get into analogue printing without the expense or need for a darkroom, Pinsta is here to help! Simply load your negatives into the internal enlargement slide and you can enlarge them onto 4x5 inch paper. You can even create prints with fun and creative frames and overlays using Pinsta's ingenious internal slide system.



A photo taken with Pinsta onto Harman direct positive paper. Exposure time 2.5 minutes


Anyone can use Pinsta to produce photographic prints of their own, at home or out and about and without any further investment in darkroom equipment besides a dark bag for loading your next shot. Nothing beats the feeling of mounting your very own real photographic prints around your home.



Enlarge your negatives to 4x5 using Pinsta


The sense of wonder you get upon revealing your first perfectly exposed photographic print can't be matched! You will learn from the prints you get wrong, and you will treasure the prints that you get right. This is raw photography, it's really good fun, it draws a crowd and it's a little bit of magic!

 Find out what Mike Padua thinks of Pinsta Camera:








Loading paper, taking photos and developing your Prints:



Loading your Pinsta camera couldn't be easier, simply put your camera and your photographic paper into the dark/changing bag to load a new piece of paper into the camera back. To take a shot simply position your camera and open the shutter. Typical exposure on a sunny day is 2 minutes.



A photo taken with Pinsta onto Harman direct positive paper. Exposure time 3 minutes


Your prints are developed with regular photographic chemistry and it is inserted and extracted with syringes.  When you are developing the camera body is your darkroom and your camera back becomes your developing tray!



A clear demonstrational version of Pinsta shows how it develops prints internally


Developing of black and white paper is a simple process so you can't really get it wrong. Develop for 1 minute, fix for 30 seconds to 4 minutes (depending on the paper) and add water to wash before revealing your amazing photographic print. A set of syringes will develop around 4-5 shots depending on which photographic paper you are using. The syringes are then replenished with your own chemistry once it is exhausted. 

Enlarging negatives:



Enlarging negatives with Pinsta is very much like taking a photo except that you position the negative inside the camera in-between the pinhole and the photographic paper using Pinsta's unique negative enlargement slide.
You then rotate the shutter disc to position the diffuser spot over the pinhole. Illuminating this spot with a bright light source transposes your negative onto the photographic paper inside. Your enlargement is then developed as if you had taken a photo. 


Using the Light Baffle/Filter slide to customize images:
The internal light baffle prevents light from bouncing off the camera walls and fogging your image but it can also be used as a filter slide and for customising your photos or enlargements with overlays, textures, double exposures or shaped exposures..  There is a huge amount of creative potential with this slide. 



Using Pinsta's light baffle for filters and customised exposures





Customising the shape of your exposures with the light baffle/filter slide



Available add-ons/accessories:






PLEASE NOTE, INTERCHANGEABLE PINHOLE SYSTEM NOW INCLUDED IN ALL KITS!


£30K - Laser cut Pinsta keyring: UNLOCKED!
If we reach £30,000 we will include a Pinsta laser cut keyring with each Pinsta Kit





£50K - Laser cut Pinsta keyring with print removal suction cup:  UNLOCKED!
If we reach £50k then the keyring add on becomes a handy print removal tool! This makes removing your developed prints much easier!





£100K - 4x5 Magnetic frame included for each backer!
If we reach £100k we will include a free 4x5 Magnetic Display/Drying frame with each Pinsta Kit.





£200K - Pinsta community forum will be created:
If we reach £200k we will create an online forum for people to share their works, ideas and techniques. We expect many people will invent new ways of using Pinsta and we think a forum would be a nice melting pot for creators to get together. We may even hold annual awards events later on.





£N/A - Interchangeable pinhole system: NOW INCLUDED!
at £300k we can add an interchangeable pinhole system, this will make Pinsta much more versatile going into the future. We believe we can vastly improve the enlarging quality of Pinsta if the Pinhole is modular and it will also enable us to potentially make larger backs for Pinsta such as 5x7 or 10x8 as Pinsta's current pinhole would be too small for these formats.





£500K - Company dedicated focus on Pinsta: 
£500k would mean we can dedicate a large amount of our resources onto Pinsta and related upgrades in the future. We may even decide to focus the company on Pinsta entirely.















We have lots of plans for Pinsta and our hope is that it becomes a mainstay in the photography world. We see Pinsta not only as great fun for the hobbyist and an excellent tool for artistic creators but also as a brilliant learning tool. Our hope is that Pinsta cameras will be used all over the world in education and in recreational photography workshops alike. 

Future accessories for Pinsta might include:


Film backs for 35mm and 120
Wide angle back
Narrow angle extension back
10x8" back
Dedicated phone app for automatic exposure calculation


We also expect that we can improve the enlarging sharpness of Pinsta in the future by offering a body extension section and a smaller pinhole.



Brenda Stuart (one of our testers) using Pinsta at the playground @brendaclairestuart










Pinsta kit with all accessories and add-ons


I don't know about traditional processes and I'm a bit confused!? How exactly does it work?
Don't worry, Pinsta couldn't be easier to use. We will be providing full detailed instructions in nice and easy to understand videos which start at the very basics of taking photos with Pinsta. Some of the more advanced features can then be learned over time which is what makes Pinsta a wonderful learning tool.

How does Pinsta achieve a positive image?
Pinsta can be used with HARMAN direct positive paper which is available in 4x5 size. Using this paper means that your prints come out positive with a normal develop and fix process. Magic!

What do I need to use Pinsta?
In order to take photographs with Pinsta all you need is one of our kits and a film changing bag which are available as an add on. For paper and chemistry we recommend and have tested HARMAN 4x5 direct positive paper, ILFORD multigrade developer and ILFORD rapid fixer. 





If you wish to enlarge negatives with Pinsta you will also need the negative enlargement slide (available as an add on) and we recommend and have tested ILFORD 4x5 multigrade RC delux (negative) paper. In addition you will need a nice bright light source, almost any light source will do but we recommend something like an ultra bright LED torch that can be positioned closely to the diffuser spot as this will reduce exposure times. Ideally it should be plugged-in to the mains since this gives more consistent results than relying on battery power. Most rechargeable units can remain plugged in whilst in use. 





Paper and chemistry are available as a kit at a discounted price for Pinsta backers at www.firstcallphotographic.com. We will provide backers with a discount code once the campaign has ended. 

Can I use different processes in Pinsta?
You can. Pinsta can be used however you want. If you have a different chemical process or medium you would like to use then Pinsta should be compatible with most things. Extra syringes are available if you have additional processes such as chemical reversal etc. We are very excited to see how people use Pinsta in different creative ways!

How does Pinsta extract chemistry through that hole?
The chemistry hole in the side of Pinsta leads to a tube which goes down to the tray. The chemistry is delivered and picked up right next to your photographic paper, it doesn't squirt in opposite the hole on the outer body..

Do I have to keep buying chemistry syringes?
No you refill the syringes that come with the kit. This also saves on plastic waste associated with instant camera cartridge systems. They should last indefinitely and will be provided with coloured stickers so that you can identify which syringe is for which chemistry. 





Is there much cleaning in-between each use?
There is a little wiping required but not much. ABS is quite water repellent and most of the liquids are extracted by syringe. We recommend taking out a towel with you. A quick wipe of the bottom 20mm's of the camera body and the tray and it's ready to go again. Agitation is a gentle process and chemistry doesn't splash around inside if you are doing it correctly.

Can I shoot film in Pinsta?
You can shoot 4x5 film no problems! It is possible for more advanced users to shoot 35mm or 120 film by cutting it and putting it into the internal enlargement slide. This would probably require a darkroom though as it would prove fiddly in a dark bag. We do plan to release film backs for Pinsta at a later date along with many other accessories and add-ons.





What are typical Exposure times of Pinsta?
Pinsta is rated at F266 and Ilford direct positive paper is ISO 1-3. Typical exposure times are: Very sunny 1-2 minutes, Sunny 2-4 minutes, Sunny with clouds 4-12 minutes, Cloudy 12-30 minutes, Dull daylight conditions 40min-4hours. Indoor conditions can vary massively depending on lighting etc.
Enlargement exposure times vary depending on your light source and the particular type of negatives you are using between 1 minute and 60 minutes. Black and white negative enlarge much faster than colour negatives.

Is Pinsta expensive to use?
The cost of the chemistry will come in at pennies per shot. Ilford direct positive paper rrp is £1 or $1.39 per sheet. Ilford Multigrade (negative) paper rrp is £0.53p or $0.73 per sheet. Polariod 600's rrp by comparison is £2.50 or $3.47 per shot and provides much smaller photos. (costs based on UK prices and may vary depending on your location/availability).
Paper and chemistry are available as a kit at a discounted price for Pinsta backers at www.firstcallphotographic.com. We will provide backers with a discount code once the campaign has ended. 



A photo taken with Pinsta onto Harman direct positive paper. Exposure time 2.5 minutes


Are my negatives safe inside Pinsta?
The internal negative slide has been designed to protect your negatives from any splashing that may occur during the developing process. If you would prefer you can actually remove the negative slide from the camera using the dark bag after exposure and before developing. This means your negatives are not at any risk at all.

How good is the enlarging quality?
The enlarging quality from 120 negatives is surprisingly good considering that it is a lenseless system and certainly good enough for putting 4x5 pictures around your home, the larger the negatives the sharper the image for various reasons. The 35mm enlargements are a little softer and we recommend they are most useful for portraits and images that have less small details in them. Please see the examples section below for examples of each type of image.





Pinhole:
Pinholes have infinite focal length, so everything is in focus which is what makes many of the features of Pinsta possible. Pinsta camera includes a pinhole carefully selected at the right diameter (0.3mm's) and is manufactured using a special process called double etching, which ensures the absolute highest quality images possible are produced.
The quality of the pinhole is crucial to image quality. Professional quality double chemically etched pinholes aren't cheap and many other pinhole camera kits come with drilled or laser cut pinholes to save money.. Not Pinsta.



Pinsta's double chemically etched 0.3mm pinhole



Shutter:
Pinsta's shutter is different to any other camera on the market. It includes 3 photo settings for full frame and round and oval vignetted crop shots.
This rotates on a clicker which locks each setting into place. The lever allows you to switch to another setting quickly and easily.
The shutter disc also houses the white diffuser spot which is used for enlarging negatives. The diffuser spot is positioned over the pinhole and is illuminated using any external light source. This light passes through the negative and projects the negative  onto your photographic paper.



Pinsta's unique rotating shutter disc



Body:
The Pinsta body is made from thick 'pinseal' ABS and has a nice weight and high quality feel to it with landscape and portrait bubble levels. It has a number of cool features, the most significant of which is the ability to add and extract chemistry through a special light tight cavity using syringes. This means when developing your images your camera body is actually also your darkroom. 
The body also includes 2 tripod mounts for portrait and landscape shots, 2 bubble levels and gun sights to ensure you're getting the correct framing.



Pinsta camera body




Camera Back/Tray:
The back of your camera is also your developing tray. It includes magnets which fix it to the camera body and ensure perfect light tightness. This accommodates 4x5 inch photo paper or film. The photographic paper is sandwiched between the camera back and the camera body which holds it flat and in place when shooting and developing. The paper also acts as a gasket which prevents the chemistry from leaking.



Magnetic camera Back/Tray



Enlargement Slide: (available as an add-on)
The enlargement slide can accommodate 35mm, 645, 6x6 and 6x7 negatives (6x7 size will be cropped to 6x6). There are different mounting positions inside the camera body depending on which negative size you are using.
The possibilities are quite literally endless with the internal slide system and we're really excited to see what our backers do with this innovation. Advanced users can even shoot film using these slides, or double expose a new shot with an existing negative..



Pinsta's unique internal enlargement slide



Internal Light Baffle/Filter Slide: (included in all kits)
The internal light baffle/filter slide is similar to the enlargement slide but it is used to prevent unwanted light from bouncing around inside the camera and fogging your prints. This is one of the reasons that Pinsta gives excellent image quality.
This slide can also be used for attaching filters or for customising your images with custom shaped exposures when you are shooting or enlarging. It is designed to be left in the camera at all times when shooting in the slide position closest to the pinhole. 



Internal light baffle/filter slide



Dark Bag: (available as an add-on)
The dark bag is a light tight bag used to load your next shot into the camera. It keeps your paper or film from being exposed to light during its journey between the paper box and the camera. Our dark bags are bigger than some others on the market which makes loading your Pinsta camera a little easier. 



Changing bag


Drying/Display Frames: (available as an add-on)
Our magnetized drying frames are used for keeping your print relatively flat whilst it dries. Fiber based papers can bend quite a lot whilst drying so if you intend to shoot mostly fiber based papers such as Harman direct positive paper then we suggest adding on a few drying frames. These ensure that your prints dry evenly and remain flat whilst they dry.
These frames can also be used to display your photographs around the house and are great for displaying your work as fridge magnets!



4x5 display/drying frame



Contact Plate/Print Press: (available as an add-on)
More advanced users may like our magnetized contact plate add on. The contact plate means that you can produce 'false' positive images using negative paper. 
This plate produces a perfect positive replica of your negative by sandwiching it with a fresh piece of negative paper and then exposing it to light. You can then transfer the exposed false positive to your Pinsta inside a dark bag for developing as normal.
It can also be used as a print press! Leave them in here for a day or two and they'll be perfectly flat.



Contact plate/print press


Syringe:
Each kit comes with 3 or more syringes, these syringes are used for inserting and extracting your chemistry. They come with coloured stickers for identifying which syringe is for which chemistry. Additional syringes are available as an add-on.



Syringes are inserted into a small hole in the side of Pinsta to insert and extract chemistry



Syringe Dock: (available as an add-on)
The syringe dock is used to store your syringes. This keeps them safe and secure during transit and also makes them easier to organize when developing prints. The syringe dock also has a handy strap mount so they can be mounted onto the strap of your camera bag



Syringe dock



Bottle Kit: (available as an add-on)
The bottle kit includes 3 chemistry bottles and one larger dump bottle.  The bottles have sealed lids. These come in very useful especially if you plan on taking lots of photos whilst you're out or are going on a longer excursion. The larger tops allow easy access for your syringes.
You must always dispose of your exhausted chemistry in a responsible manner so even if you don't add our bottle kit you will need to carry storage for your spent chemistry.



Bottle kit







Here are some examples of photos and enlargements made with Pinsta Camera. 



Photos taken with Pinsta





Zoomed examples of above photos





Left: Enlarged 35mm negative. Right: enlarged 645 (120) negative





Zoomed examples of above enlargements





Photo taken with Pinsta of Nikon F Photomic










Enlargement made from 645 negative







Find more images and video examples on our instagram page:










My name is Oliver, I am 35 years old and have been a keen photographer and inventor my life so far, taking after my Dad Harry New who invented the Nova Vertical slot print processor back in the 1980's.



My father and my brother Matthew recently designed a brand new combined processor and washer darkroom system called Optima which we successfully launched on kickstarter in 2019


Sitting on a stool next to my dad in his darkroom is one of my most distinct memories as a small child. The combination of sounds, smells and the wonder of watching images illuminated by the red glow of the safelight magically appear in front of my eyes is something I will never forget. He would often shoot weddings and show jumping events and would occasionally let me sit in on his darkroom sessions.



A photo of me taken with Pinsta onto negative paper and inverted digitaly. Exposure time 1 minute 15 seconds


My first proper camera was a Pentax ME and I had a fascination with long exposures and used to go into the garden at night experimenting, setting my camera up with a fixed open shutter and shining my torch on the plants and trees. I'd take the film up to the local photography shop to have it developed for collection the next day. The anticipation all part of the enjoyment of the process. Something lost with the instant gratification lifestyles we all live in now..



Pinhole cameras we already produce at our factory


Years on and in a small factory in rural Warwickshire our family company had been hand making pinhole cameras for one of the biggest names in the industry when one day it occurred to me that there was an opportunity for us to produce something more accessible to people without a darkroom. Something that could hopefully introduce new people into the magic of traditional photography, and to help advanced photographers learn even more about the origins their trade. From this idea Pinsta was born...


The development of Pinsta:



Just some of the different Pinsta prototypes we have produced


Product prototyping is one of the things our company does, which is fortunate as it has saved us a lot of costs which we can actually pass on to you! Overall we've spent around a year developing Pinsta to the complete product it is now. 



Parts drawing for Pinsta components


We have produced around 15 different designs of various types. Continual improvements have been made to the designs of the shutter disc, chemistry/ventilation system, sights, pinhole, tray/back and internal slide system.



Prototypes in production. Much more sophisticated jigs will be produced for large scale production. If Pinsta does well enough the main body and tray/back will be injection moulded.


Pinsta at the Photography Show:
We thoroughly enjoyed exhibiting at the photography show and received nothing but amazing comments and feedback on Pinsta. We felt it was important to show that Pinsta was a serious and fully developed product and what better way to do this than demonstrate it to thousands of people at the show. I did many demonstrations and interviews for various magazines and publications. 
Thankyou to everyone who showed up and gave their support, some people even came just to see Pinsta!

Amateur Photographer Magazine recorded this live negative enlargement demonstration for their social media platforms (poor sound):



 Sunny 16 Podcast also popped over and made a video and we should be featuring on their podcast soon:



 Jon Bentley from the Gadget show even paid a visit:
















There is no doubt that photography in all its forms can have a huge impact on mental health. The combination of elements that involve the process make it an inherently therapeutic pass time. Getting out somewhere you might not otherwise go, meeting people, engaging in an art form, joining a community, the enjoyment of taking beautiful images and the continual pursuit of learning (because there is always more to learn) are just some of the reasons why photography brings so many people so much happiness.





We believe that analogue photography in particular encourages a state of mindfulness and the slower processes are in themselves a meditation. In a world where everything is fast and on demand it's a wonderful liberation to rediscover the joy of taking your time and enjoying a real tactile and thought provoking process.



A big thankyou:

Lastly I'd like to give a big thankyou to Mark Anthony Galluzzo and his company Mabinogi who not only produced our campaign video for us but did a great deal of testing with Pinsta. We couldn't have been more happy with them and the genuinely personal service that they provided.
https://www.mabinogi.co.uk/crowdfunding/





 If you would like further updates on new Pinsta products/accessories after the campaign then please join our mailing list at www.pinstacamera.com

record.Creator: Amonito
record.Title: Amonito - The Lightest All-In-One Guitar Amplifier
record.Text:
Ever tried to carry a big heavy combo amp to a gig, and then transport it back home at 1 am, all in an effort to impress the audience with a great sound?
Did you buy countless expensive pedals, because you cannot play a gig with the amp giving you just one sound?
Ever tried to achieve a perfect sound with a modeling amp, but can never shake the feeling that it could be better if you maybe just spent a few more days tweaking the sound?

We tried all of that.

All of the hardship of those problems manifested into creating a truly unique solution, a guitar amp that is light and versatile, and sounds incredible with every setting you have it set to.
You no longer need to make a choice between the quality, warmth, and ease of use of a tube amplifier and the versatility and lightness of modern guitar systems.




















Amonito is a guitar amplification system that brings together boutique guitar effects, an incredible sounding tube analog circuit, instant switching between presets, and a quality loud sound monitoring system all in one extremely light package.















Three main segments are responsible for Amonito sounding as good as it does.

Symbiosis of the switchable high voltage analog TUBE circuit and digital signal processing
Custom user interface that offers versatility and programmability without the need to read the manual
A new concept of guitar speaker cabinet placement

Each of these is a novelty on the guitar amp market, but together they make for one of the most incredible pieces of guitar gear that the world has ever seen.





SYMBIOSIS OF THE SWITCHABLE HIGH VOLTAGE ANALOG TUBE CIRCUIT AND DIGITAL SIGNAL PROCESSING
At the heart of Amonito is the main analog compact circuit, that responds and sounds like a full tube amp. A combination of two vacuum tubes, 12AX7 and 12AU7, and MOSFETS are all running on high voltage to give the guitarist ultimate dynamic range and feel that no digital processing could accomplish. Dozens of strategically placed little electronic switches make this one of the most versatile tube circuits on the market today.





And because almost every player needs effects like reverb, chorus, delay, and others, we added a special chip - one of the most powerful SHARC® DSPs that is responsible for all of the effects that complete the sound coming out of the analog circuit.
We could have stopped there, but there was one thing bothering us.
What many guitarists that have played tube amps know is that they don’t sound amazing on just any setting - they have a sweet spot. A certain setting that sounds the best, but this makes the amp less versatile and you can’t always have it as loud as necessary to get to it.
And since we have that SHARC® power, we put the DSP before and after the analog circuit!





This is how we achieved total control of the sound and made one sweet spot a thing of the past! The amp has now become interconnected with thousands of parameters, many of them helping to prepare the sound for its journey in the high voltage analog world, and the rest applying finishing touches after it transitions back into the digital. No other analog amp has ever had such flexibility!








CUSTOM USER INTERFACE THAT OFFERS VERSATILITY AND PROGRAMMABILITY WITHOUT READING THE MANUAL






You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.





Play

































Replay with sound









Play with  sound












00:00


00:00































Playing and creating music is a deeply intimate process and with our product, we want the guitarists to spend their time in the creative zone and to enjoy the experience instead of tweaking every single parameter while reading the manual.
To address this, instead of offering an off-the-shelf LCD and a thick manual on how to use it, we designed custom touchscreen displays like you haven’t seen before. There are no pixels, it feels and looks analog.





Each knob on these displays is smartly connected to many parameters and intertwined with other knobs so that you get a beautifully simple experience while the system in the background does all the hard work to keep the sound great no matter what you do.





Combined with extremely reliable optical footswitches, to which the user can assign their own personal settings, you are now in instant control of not just the effects, but also the whole analog tube amp structure, with just a push of a single button.





Amonito features a wireless access point, so when we upgrade the software, you would just have to use the app to upload the latest release. No need for a cable, all of the software updates will be available wirelessly through the app, so uploading the latest released firmware on Amonito will be made as simple as possible.






You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.





Play

































Replay with sound









Play with  sound












00:00


00:00
































A NEW CONCEPT OF GUITAR SPEAKER CABINET PLACEMENT
To make it as light and sturdy as possible, we moved away from wood for the construction material and chose - aluminum for the more affordable Classic version and carbon fiber for the premium, Carbon version.





With a ported design to give you a deep, full sound, and a power amplifier that delivers 200W RMS this cabinet is truly something different. The sound of a high-quality 8” neodymium speaker is being further enhanced by our processing and is firing into a specially constructed wave deflector to give you a smooth top end and wide coverage with high frequencies. It doesn’t sound like a guitar speaker, but like a guitar speaker that has been professionally miked up in the studio, and with different amps you also hear different speakers! You haven’t heard an 8” speaker that sounds like this.





But we went one step further! 
We completely changed the way you hear this speaker system on stage and moved it from the usual position in the back to the front where the guitarist can hear it much better. This way the sound spill from the stage is greatly reduced - sound guys will absolutely love it! And with dedicated XLR outputs for the PA, it means that the audience will get to enjoy great sound too.










We paired Amonito with some of the most popular electric guitars, played by guitarists with their unique style. While many modern amplifiers sound similar with different guitars and players, Amonito really lets the character of the guitar and guitarist's technique shine through.




















Andy Cortes
Andy is a London-based guitar player influenced by Eric Clapton, Albert Collins, and other guitar legends. Andy has toured with James Bay for many years and has also played with one of the blues greats, Buddy Guy. 
He was a founding member of the band Cortes and is now also creating his original work under his name, Andy Cortes.



Oz Marshall (YT Channel: Guitar Safari)
Oz has played with members of Judas Priest, Alice Cooper, Cradle of Filth, and has Manowar guitarist David Snake, as well as many others, guesting on the new CD of his band Snake Eyes.
   He also has a YouTube channel "Guitar Safari" where he does gear reviews.








Both of our products feature the same analog tube circuit, the same amplifier and speaker, and the same user interface. But, there are differences between them that make the Carbon version a more premium model.










Both versions of Amonito offer the same functionality, which is comprised of 5 main stages:

Pre Effects
Amplifier
Equalization
Post Effects
Power and mute







You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.





Play

































Replay with sound









Play with  sound












00:00


00:00































Pre Effects section
The PRE section includes guitar effects that are used in front of an amplifier by most guitarists. Just like normal pedals, these effects have a lot of control, but most of it is hidden away in our smart processing. Only one of these effects can be on at the same time.





Amplifier section
There are four types of amplifiers to choose from, two base models and two variants of them. Each one has a different sound and feel, thanks to the extensive physical switching of the analog circuit.





Equalization section
Everyone is probably familiar with EQ settings, but while simple to use, on Amonito, these are much more powerful than it seems at first glance.
With the help of smart processing, the whole amplifier is reacting to these settings so that is not simply an EQ after the amplifier section, but it is modifying the signal so that you “get what you wish for”.





For example, if you would like to have the sound from a bright clean vintage amplifier (assuming a vintage clean model is selected on the AMP section), simply increase the treble and possibly reduce the bass and the whole amp will shift around these parameters to provide you with a sound that would be produced by a typical bright vintage tube amp. Even effects before the amplifier will adjust to these settings.

Post Effects section
(Almost) no guitar sound is perfect without some kind of reverb, delay, or other modulation effects - or even all together.





Power and mute
The last thing every amplifier needs is a way to turn it on and off and to be able to mute all of the outputs with just one button. Both of these have been incorporated into our displays.










Amonito offers all the main connections you need in a live or a studio environment. 
First, the signal is received by a high impedance FET input that preserves its original clarity and definition and is sent to the rest of the circuitry via a low noise balanced connection.
Since many guitarists will never part with their own choice of pedals and effects, Amonito offers a send/return loop that is positioned after the analog tube circuit and can be switched on or off via a button on the displays. This allows the user to turn the send/return loop on or off using the footswitches on Amonito.
Since the built-in speaker is intended to be used as a personal stage guitar monitoring system, Amonito features two other main outputs to be used either in the studio or in a live performance. Line outputs are carrying a raw signal, that can either be processed by software plugins in a studio environment or plugged into another power amp on stage. The XLR outputs carry a signal that has been optimized for live, PA applications. A high-quality IR cabinet simulation makes sure that even the most nit-picking live sound technicians will be satisfied with the sound. And of course, these outputs can be used in a studio recording for a very quick and effortless setup.
Amonito Carbon comes with stereo Send/return, line, and XLR output connections, while ALL the connections on Amonito Classic are mono. 










We believe that a high-quality product such as Amonito should never be carried around without protection. Therefore, we will be shipping every product with a corresponding padded bag.
Currently, we only have one prototype for the bag ready, and it will take some trial and error to get it just the way we want it. But, we can tell you that the final bag will be light, padded on all sides, and equipped with a carrying handle and backpack straps! This way, you will be able to easily take Amonito everywhere you go and will not have to worry about damaging the surface or hardware.
For even more reliable transportation, we will be offering a hard case made from fiberglass. It will be available for purchase as an add-on, but later on, once the project has been successfully funded.

























We are Marko and Andraž and we come from Slovenia, Europe. Both electrical engineers and both musicians. Our journey of building guitar amplifiers began about 6 years ago when we decided to build our first unique tube amp. Since then we have designed and built many guitar amplifiers, bass and guitar effects, and other audio products. During this time we were actively involved in our bands, playing all sorts of big and small venues, meeting all sorts of musicians, especially guitarists, and getting to know their musical styles, habits, problems, and wishes. We discovered that a lot of them were unhappy with their gear, may it be the weight, sound, limitations, and even complexity of the modern guitar equipment.
That's where the idea of creating our innovative guitar amplifier came in.
We discovered that with our knowledge of electrical engineering, programming, and amp building we could make a difference by providing guitarists with an amplifier that sounds just as good as the old tube amps, but is extremely lighter, includes all the must-have modern effects, offers the choice of completely restructuring the analog tube circuit with a flick of a preset switch, but still remains as easy and intuitive to use as the old amps were. No more back hurting at 3 AM after a concert. No more confusing connections between pieces of gear. No more spending weeks or even months in your studio, trying to find that perfect sound. Just lighter, smarter, and intuitive. The vision for the AMONITO guitar amplifier was born.
After more than a year of prototyping and validating the concept of innovative weight reduction techniques we pitched this idea to the start-up incentive program P2 at the Slovene enterprise fund and got the grant. This enabled us to assemble a small team and continue working on the project. Since then it has almost been two years, and during this time the whole team worked very hard to make this project a reality.
We can't tell you how excited we are to finally be able to offer Amonito to guitarists all over the world!
Marko and Andraž, founders and lead developers of the AMONITO guitar amplifier

Learn more about us

record.Creator: QingYing E&T LLC
record.Title: iMicro Q2p: An 800x Polarizing Fingertip Microscope
record.Text:
From 2018 to 2020, we took Kickstarter by storm with the Fingertip Microscopes - iMicro Q, iMicro C, and iMicro Q2, earning 20K pledges from the community over 40K iMicros delivered to our backers in over 70 countries. It is a breakthrough in portable microscopy - we're pretty proud, and thank you all for your support.





We keep improving and polishing the iMicros, and we never stop - now we've taken our effort one step further and are pleased to bring you the new fingertip microscope - iMicro Q2p, the first smartphone microscope with polarizing function.
What is Fingertip Microscope (iMicro Q2p)?
Since Antony van Leeuwenhoek invented his microscope in the 17th century, microscope technology has progressed tremendously. Microscopes with excellent performance are usually bulky, heavy, and expensive, even for portable ones. With our years of effort, what we introduced in 2018 - the fingertip microscope iMicro Q - is a real breakthrough in mobile microscopy. It has comparable optical performance to a professional desktop microscope and enables you to carry it with you as easily as you bring your phone. In addition to the iMicro Q's excellent optical performance and portability, we launched iMicro Q2 in 2020 with enhanced compatibility to work with any smartphone.
Polarized light is a contrast-enhancing technique that improves the quality of the image obtained with birefringent materials, such as crystals, minerals, liquid crystals, and plastics. The polarized light microscope (polarizing microscope) is designed to observe and photograph specimens primarily due to its optically anisotropic character. Usually, a polarized light microscope is much more expensive and only available for professionals. Now with iMicro Q2p, in addition to the function of a typical biology microscope, we bring you this tiny Fingertip Microscope with the fantastic polarizing function.





Highlights

The first smartphone polarizing microscope
Improved focusing control with the focusing stand
Very high magnification power: up to 800x
Very high resolution power: Down to 1 micron
Very low distortion: Comparable to a desktop microscope
Shallow profile and weight: ½ inch and ~1/60 oz
Extremely easy to carry: fit in wallet like a card
Meager cost: ~1% of the price of a desktop microscope
Compatible with any smartphone


Here are some micrographs took with iMicro Q2p (using an iPhone 11):





Here are more example micrographs with polarizers and without polarizers - solid proof that the polarizing function dramatically enhanced the contrast with rich colors.





Key features of iMicro Q2p

The first smartphone polarizing microscope

To our knowledge, iMicro Q2p is the first smartphone microscope with the polarizing function integrated with such a small profile.  






 Improved focusing control with the focusing stand 

Our previous backers queried a lot on a focusing stand/support to the fingertip microscopes. We listen to our backers, and we have worked hard on designing a convenient, flexible, intuitive stand to allow precision focusing. Finally, we have a satisfactory solution.  It works very well and is also simple to use. 
















You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.





Play

































Replay with sound









Play with  sound












00:00


00:00
































Extremely high magnification: up to 800x

It has the same high magnification as iMicro Q and Q2. Here are the micrographs of the fiber from one dental floss. If you don't have a microscope, you don't know it has such a fine structure on this fiber. It is amazing!






Very high resolution

Resolution is more important than magnification when speaking about the performance of a microscope. The USAF 1951 resolution test chart was used to test the resolution of iMicro Q2p on an iPhone 11. The intervals between the finest test bars are 2.19 micrometers. The finest test bars on the 7th group are clearly seen, indicating its resolution is far beyond that.






Very low distortion

We used a grid calibration target to test the distortion. Even in full view at the edge of the visual field, no noticeable distortion was observed.






Extremely low profile

It is about the size of a fingertip and weighs only 0.5g (~1/60 oz). It is very thin, only 3.2mm (1/8 inch). No parts extrude beyond the edge of your phone when it is installed. Also, the focusing stand has not increased the profile regarding the whole pack - still in the card size and easily fit in a wallet.






Affordable to every budget

We are very proud of the Fingertip Microscope and would like everyone to be able to afford it. With a polarizing function, we can still keep it at a low cost. With the money you would need to buy a traditional desktop microscope, you could purchase many Fingertip Microscopes, making this a great option for children and students.






Works with any smartphone

As iMicro Q2 lens and iMicro C lens, we design iMicro Q2p in a tiny round style to fit any phone with a camera. They will be coupled to your smartphone by an innovative, re-useable, nano-suction pad. Whether your phone has a single back camera or multiple back cameras, a flat camera(s), or extruded camera(s), these tiny round lenses will fit well with them. 







Principle and development process

The magnification

The magnification mainly relies on its complex optical system for traditional compound microscopes, including objective and eyepiece. Its total magnification is a combination of the magnification of objective and eyepiece.
For our fingertip microscope, three stages of magnification are combined to achieve the total magnification. First, the lens provides optical magnification to generate the image on the smartphone camera's sensor; second, the image on the sensor is displayed on the much larger screen via the electronic process and magnification; third, digital zoom provides further magnification as a digital magnification to the image. The total magnification is a combination of these three.





The traditional polarizing microscope has a complex structure. Especially a polarizer and another polarizer (analyzer) are added before and after the specimen in the optical system. For iMicro Q2p, we mimic this polarizing structure but keep it in a small profile.






Development path and process

We have walked a long way to develop these smartphone-based microscopic tools since registering the first patent in 2012. We have already successfully built a series of smartphone microscope products, including iMICROSCOPE, iMICROSCOPE R, and the μRuler, iMicro Q, iMicro C, iMicro Q2, as well as this new version iMicro Q2p.





We have shaped and polished our Fingertip Microscope idea according to previous backers' and customers' suggestions and comments based on our previous successful projects. We have optimized the optics and the overall design, and each step was tested and refined using prototypes to achieve the best performance possible.






Structure detail







The essential techniques 

Stress-free multi-element aspherical micro-lens with polarizer integrated

The lens is a crucial component of the system. A small ball lens (van Leeuwenhoek) is a straightforward approach. But it is well known to suffer from a very limited usable field of view due to severe field curvature effects, spherical and other aberrations. The iMicro Q2p uses a more complex multi-aspherical lens design and integrated polarizer to achieve high magnification performance and low aberration with polarizing function.






Innovative illumination: Reflection/transmission lighting with polarizer

In iMicro Q2p, we incorporated a new reflection/polarizing/transmission lighting. The thin PP case is not only used to pack and protect the product but also used as a light-reflective illumination box. The light from the flashlight and ambient light goes to the bottom of the lighting box and is reflected from the thin PP case's bottom wall to illuminate the sample after being polarized. 







 Seamless coupling with the smartphone: Nano-suction pad attachment 

Unlike conventional adhesive, the nano suction pad mimics gecko's footpads: it has thousands of micro air pockets functioning like micro-suction cups to hold the device to the phone.





Every on and off application will leave nothing on the phone. This newly developed "nano suction pad" is residue-free, non-tacky, and repeatable. The use of a nano suction pad has been proved in our previous product, and it is repeatable and easily cleaned by a PSA tape (such as Scotch tape).

Easy focus with focusing stand

We believe you will like this focusing stand - it works very well and keeps a low profile. It is made of engineering plastic (PMMA, acrylic resin) and is strong enough with durability. It is also very simple and easy to set up to use. After using it, you can disassembly it and store it in the thin PP case.






You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.





Play

































Replay with sound









Play with  sound












00:00


00:00
































μRuler and Dedicated App: for professional needs

A high-quality μRuler M (stage micrometer) will be provided with iMicro Q2p to calibrate the scale-bar in our App, i-Seeing, and enable you to measure size accurately. Please see our previous campaign, μRuler- A micro-ruler to measure micro-objects, for more information. μRuler Q will be available as an add-on.





iMicro Q2p actually works with any camera App which can control the flashlight when shooting or you provide illumination with an extra torch. In some cases, it is crucial to have a scale-bar and ensure its accuracy on the micrograph. The dedicated App, i-Seeing, was designed to take micrographs to meet professional demand. The scale-bar on the micrograph can be toggled on/off to enable you to embed a scale-bar on the image if required.





Comparison of iMicro Q2,  C, and Q2p





What people say about Fingertip Microscope





Application
It is super portable, and you don't need complicated settings, so you can immediately take images, use them for reporting and transferring images to your colleagues. Plus, you can use it with any smartphone. It can be used in many professions where you need accurate images and easily accessible research photographs in the field. 
Many of our previous backers shared their application with beautiful and unique pictures when using the fingertip microscopes. Here are a few examples. Many of them are from our previous backers' photos with the iMicro Q2 and iMicro C on their phones; Some of them are our test photos for the polarizing function. With the polarizing function, you will have more power for its application.

record.Creator: Vissles
record.Title: Vissles LP85: Ultra-Thin 75% Optical-Mechanical Keyboard
record.Text:
Keyboard is the tool in which we interact with the world wide web. It's what we use for an online battle and performing tasks. Having an outperformed keyboard makes huge differences in efficiency and responsiveness.
Introducing Vissles LP85,  a 75% ultra-slim optical-mechanical keyboard crafted for speed, precision, and comfort. The LP85 strives a perfect balance between a conventional and a mechanical keyboard, its low-profile optical switches give you the type feel of a mechanical keyboard but in an ergonomic way, and it helps prevent fatigue from long hours of typing.





 Low-profile optical keyboards bring numerous advantages to users, simply put, due to the unique pre-travel distance, optical switches are highly responsive with a subtle crisp sound, which makes LP85 deliver a better gaming and typing experience that is far beyond membrane keyboards. Without constant contact under the hook, the life expectancy of LP85 is beyond doubt, not to mention its ergonomic and lightweight design.





Besides the N-key rollover technology with 50g actuation force, 0.2ms speedy response, and 1.2mm pre-travel, LP85 also features 19 dynamic RGB for both Mac & Windows users











You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.





Play

































Replay with sound









Play with  sound












00:00


00:00




































Providing a perfect combination of aesthetics and durability, LP85 is constructed with a solid aluminum frame. To be crowned as the world’s slimmest 85-key low-profile keyboard, LP85 shrinks its size by 0.47 inches, making it thinner than peer products. Its low-profile design makes it more comfortable to type and easier to move around with.










LP85 is built for excellence and novelty, the premium X-optical switches deliver a light beam of 0.2ms, pair with the short actuation distance of 1.2mm pre-travel and 2.5mm total travel, a perfect option for gaming enthusiasts who demand instant actuation, satisfying clicky feedback, and rapid-fire inputs.





Traditionally, optical switches have been used by a small handful of gaming laptops like the 2019 Razer Blade 15. However, due to its high price, users are often hesitant to give it a try. Vissles is eager to share an equally unparalleled typing experience with mechanical keyboard enthusiasts at a reasonable price, your satisfaction drives us to go further.










 LP85's clicky optical switches are lightweight, easy on the fingers. By utilizing a light beam instead of metallic contact for signals, generating the fastest response time than ever.





 With fewer physical moving parts, it’s clear that optical keyboards last longer, with the ultimate stability and responsiveness, the LP8 is perfect for gamers who opt for an insane speed.





RGB backlit under each keycap, allowing you to choose from unique 19 dynamics and 8 monochrome backlit modes, matching your battle intensity during gameplay,  or reflecting the art of calm in the middle of the night.










If you are looking for a new keyboard to partner with your MacBook Pro or Mac Mini, LP85 is one of your best choices. Featuring a similar spacing mode and keycap layout to Magic Keyboard, it also supports Mac functions keys. Get the comfort and ease of desktop-style typing on your MacBook, iPhone, and iPad.





If you are a Windows user, LP85 also got you covered, we also offer a black and white scheme for you to choose from.










The high-quality ABS keycaps are lined with a fingerprint-resistant, soft-touch coating, which is extremely comfortable to use. High-end printing makes characters clear and not easy to fade, providing an unrivaled typing experience.










LP 85 might be compact, but it doesn't compromise. It can be paired with up to 3 Bluetooth devices via Bluetooth 5.0, allowing you to seamlessly switch between desktops, laptops, and mobile phones with just a tap.





LP85 supports macOS®,  Windows®, Chrome OS®, Android™, Linux®, and iOS systems. It also comes with USB Type-C for wired connection and charging.










When work-from-home has become a new normal in the face of a pandemic, mobility and flexibility are more important than ever.  Weighed only 547g, LP85 is easy to carry and outfitted with Bluetooth so you can multitask at home, on the go, or at your favorite cafe.
