Its a Enterprice Solution build with the Invission Community Forum Software.
We Plan to Deploy a Server Cluster to Install the Forum Software so we can use the Downloads Section and Open it up to the Community. It allready has a Marketplace for Asset Sharing for Unreal Engine, Unity and the Hazel Engine. It will also be the Main Platform to Download our own Engine that is Currently under Development.


The Forum also allows you to create your own "Clubs". a Club is basicly a Page that you as the user can Set up to Publish your own Projects or Advertise your Development Team/Studio.

Features of the Club Option,



Club Page


Paid Club Memberships
this allows you to create a Club and set a Join Fee for users that want to Join the Club.
this allows you to create a Club for example a Game Project you are Working on and Only users that Subscribe to the Club can See the Project and Interact with the Club ( Such as the Library, Discussions and more.
The Join Fee is optional and if you deside to use it the Price to Join is up to you.

User-Created Communities
The Club is basicly a Community inside a Community. it has all the Features you would have on the Forum but just Managed by your and your Moderators. thats Perfect for Development Projects to Advertise them to others and share Screenshots and Files.
You will have your own Discussion Board, galleries, Download Section for Files and Programms, calendars and more.

Member Approval
You have Full Controll over who is able to Join the Club. you can Select your own Staff that  Moderates Content inside your Club.
It will allow you to get a Join Request from Members that want to Join the Club. thats the Perfect way to Create a Platform to share Informations with your Dev Team without anyone else to know what you are up to.


Thats Pretty Much everything about the Club Function we want to Introduce here.

Marketplace
You have the Option to Sell your own Projects on the Platform such as Asset Packs, Textures, Sound and Music and much more for the Software we have on our Platform such as UE4, Unity, Blender and more.
you also have the Option to sell diferent Items on your Club Page to your Community if you want.



Community Store Page


 Game Publishing
We also want to Support Small Indie Developers with there Projects to get on the Market. and the Platform will be the Central Spot wehre we would Communicate with Studios to get there Games on the Market and take Care about Marketing, Consulting and more. 
This is a Idea we are still working on but will be on the Platform as soon as Possible

Support
The Platform has a Inbuild Support Department. If you have specific questions about an Engine you cant find on the Internet and the Forum does not have the right answer for you, you can allways ask the Support Department. they will work closly together with you to get you to the Solution. We allways Recommend that you Post your Question first and then create a Support Request.

Store



DevHub Store


The Store is still under Development but this is a way for us to Finance the Platform in the feature. We will Provide different Items such as Merchandise or Game Keys for people that have Interest in those kind of things.

Forum



Forum


The Forum is the Core Part of the Platform. this is the place wehre you can as questions. seek feedback for your projects and chat in general. 
The Forum is currently available in German and English. French and Russian is following in mid 2022 early 2023.
The Platform currently has following Categories,

General Talk ( Wehre you can chat about anything not related to game development )
Game Jams ( here we will announce game jams to partisipate in )
Hazel Engine ( a Custom Build Engine from TheCherno)
Unreal Engine 4
Unreal Engine 5
Unity
Godot Engine
Programming Languages ( such as Java, Assembler, C and many more )
Blender
Cinema 4D
Linux ( for Networking and more.

more categories can be created on Request.


For the Feature
We want to Build a Platform that Last for a long time. We gonna Improve the Platform and the Staff over that time and want to give you a great User Experience. We are greatfull for feedback from the Community and would love to Implement your Ideas into the Project.

The Platform can be used for free and is for everyone that is interested in Game Development or people that are just interested on how games are made. 
we try to build the Platform for the Community but its all about what you wanna do with it.

What we gonna do with the Fundings raise on Kickstarter ?
We gonna Pay the Provider with that for the most part, but it is also used for Marketing to get the Platform Advertised so more People get to know it. We also pay Licensing Fees for assets that will be Sold on the Platform.

record.Creator: Kombo Audio
record.Title: The Kombo Sound System
record.Text:
The Kombo Sound System lets you play and sing anywhere at any time. It combines a battery-powered PA system and instrument amplifier simulations into one wireless, intuitive package that can be set up in seconds.










 A portable, minimalistic system - created with a strict focus on audio quality - that is easy to set up, easy to use, and sounds awesome! Made to create fulfilling positive experiences with sound and music - whether it would be on the street corner, in the wild, at home, on a stage or wherever you would like to take it - for your artistic freedom!










 Great acoustics & high quality signal processing is critical for any sound system - but it is especially important for musicians. Lets therefore jump straight into the sound of the actual system. The system is designed for both vocal & Stringed instruments. 
You can find all samples of the speaker, modules & effects at the bottom of the page, or in the SOUNDCLOUD Link:








Sharing your music has never been so easy! No complex cabling, extra pre-amps, or time-consuming setups.





 The Kombo Sound System is comprised of three main components: a speaker, a module, and a transmitter, which combined together give you the opportunity to practice, play, and perform anywhere.





 The Transmitters & modules are bundled together in connectivity packages - which provide a tailored, wireless solution for whatever instrument you are playing.  At launch we have the microphone package, and the string instrument package - each with unique features and high quality signal processing.



String instrument package left - Microphone package right












 The transmitters transmit your instrument/microphone signals wirelessly in high quality (24 bit/48 Khz) and without any noticeable latency. At launch we have two transmitter types, each paired with the corresponding Module.

String transmitter
The string transmitter is equipped with a jack connection made for electric string instruments. Additionally, if you have ever experienced your acoustic guitar sounding "thin" from your amplifier, the transmitter is equipped to fix this with the Phase switch.

Microphone transmitter
The microphone transmitter is equipped with an XLR connection made for microphones, and includes a +48V Phantom power switch so you can use all of your microphones. 



On the image is our prototype


The 5.2/5.8 Ghz radio system supports 8 channels, enabling you to connect up to 8 instruments at once (Requires 4 KOMBO Speakers to connect 8 instruments in a stack). 
You should also not worry about dropping them either as they are sturdy and made of fiber-reinforced ABS. 








 String transmitter left, Microphone transmitter right. 





Navigation of the transmitter prototype





Prototype of transmitter







 The Modules let you combine all the effects you need. 
At launch, we offer a module for electric stringed instruments, and another for vocals & other microphone duties - The String Module and The Microphone Module.



Pictures are of prototype modules


The modules are powered by the speaker as soon as you connect them through the robust magnetic latching system.
The modules internal memory saves your settings and loads them for your next playing session.










The module's interface can be easily navigated with the ring & parameter selectors. You simply select the parameter you want to adjust through the parameter selector buttons and adjust the parameter by turning the ring - with the level indicated by the LEDs.



On the image is our prototype


The string module is fitted with amp selector, which allows you to select an acoustic amp, electric guitar amp, or bass amp - each with their own signal processing path.



On the image is our prototype


The microphone module is equipped with its own effect suite, including the most popular vocal processing effects & EQ optimized for vocals.

The Modules each have a powerful, built-in M7 ARM processor, running our proprietary signal processing & amp/cap simulations. The signal processing is developed by our partners in the Audio & Music Effect development company Shift Audio (look at the bottom of the page for samples of processing)










The fully mixed and processed signal from the Modules is instantly transmitted to the Speakers through our proprietary wireless interface (Li-Sound interface).



On the image is our prototype







 By snapping the Modules on the Speaker, you can turn the Speaker into a fully-fledged guitar/bass amplifier, vocal amplifier, or both. Additionally, the speakers are modular, enabling you to stack up to six speakers together.










The device has a minimalistic style, sturdy construction, and an easy-to-navigate interface.
Each Speaker has four module connection points (two on the backside and one on each side), meaning four instruments can be connected to one speaker alone.



Speaker prototype












The speaker is designed specifically to survive rough life expected for live gigging equipment.  The enclosure is made out of 12mm plywood and High-Pressure Laminate. Beyond the sturdy enclosure, the speaker is surrounded by a protective rubber frame that protects against bumps & hits. 
Additionally, the speaker has a 3 mm anodized aluminum mesh, keeping the driver safe - no matter what would be thrown at it.
The speaker weighs 13 Kilograms, including a battery. 
The speaker is compatible with a standard 35 mm pole mount. 





The included 95 Wh battery can both be charged while the speaker is playing, and be swapped on the run - giving you the power you need to keep your performance going wherever.





You have a playtime of up to 40 hours depending on the usage, which means you could play several gigs in one day without having to charge in-between.
Additional batteries are available for purchase so that you can swap batteries in situations that might require it.
Additionally, the battery level indicator makes it easy to check up on the battery`s power.
A battery can be charged fully in 1.7 hours with the included power supply. 





A High quality sound is critical for any speaker,  but especially important when it is designed for musicians. The Kombo sound system is therefore designed and engineered with help from the highly respected Danish Audio industry.








Snapshots from the development process of the KOMBO Speakers Acoustics


The custom Dual voice coil, 8” Co-Axial driver, and a Smooth compression tweeter  enables a linear & clean output from 60 Hz, to 20kHz, making it perfect as a full range amplification system. 





Below is a video of how the sample recordings where conducted (Audio in video not recorded through microphones). 






You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.





Play

































Replay with sound









Play with  sound












00:00


00:00































In addition to the acoustic package, The Speaker is also equipped with a custom 160W (Peak) Class-D amplifier, with just 1% distortion at max volume.
Through this setup the speaker can output 110 dB max SPL @ 1 meter, enabling you to power just about any gig. Additionally, you can always boost the output power by stacking more speakers together.



Sound pressure through stacking of speakers.







The Kombo Systems' unique communication interface allows stacked speakers to automatically calibrate key acoustic parameters - so that you can focus on the music.
These calibrations include:










The speakers are modular, meaning that they instantly connect to other Kombo Sound System Speakers when stacked so that you and your friends can create different setups to power bigger gigs! You can stack up to six speakers and connect them to eight wireless instruments and modules.





This unique moularity is enabled through our patent pending Li-Sound interface. 






Additionally, the Speaker supports Bluetooth 5.0 connectivity which allows you to use the Speaker for streaming and enjoying music from your favorite artists, as well as jamming to your favorite songs or performing with a backing track.










On the back panel, you find the master volume knob and analog inputs. An instrument input (1/4'' TS), line input (1/4'' TRS), XLR input (for dynamic microphones), A mute button (Mutes all inputs to the speaker), a USB charging port (for charging your transmitter if needed or ex phones) and lastly the USB service port, which allows you to update the device`s firmware. 





The Master level knob works both as an ON/OFF button and master level adjuster, while the surrounding LED indicator helps indicate the chosen power level.



On the image is our prototype







The TS instrument input is configured with a Pre-Amplifier, designed specifically for you to connect your electro-acoustic guitar.
The TRS input is a balanced mono input, designed for Pro level signal types.
The Microphone XLR input is equipped with a high-quality Pre-Amplifier.
All inputs are fed to a high quality, 24 bit/48 Khz ADC. Through this setup, all analog inputs are mixed into the same Li-Sound stream as attached modules.





Radio, WiFi, and Bluetooth transmissions are commonly used traditional wireless music equipment but are not always optimal. We are proud to have developed a brand new and innovative way of transmitting audio without latency or high power consumption, while still keeping the cables at bay. Introducing our proprietary Li Sound Technology  - a brand new way of fast, optic audio transmission. The Technology is currently patent pending. 
There are many benefits in using this interface compared to regular wireless interfaces.



On the image is our prototype


The Li-Sound connection works between Modules & Speakers, while the transmitter & modules communicate through a powerfull radio interface - so you can move about, free of wires or worries!



On the image is our prototype












Development HUB
All Kickstarter Backers will get access to the exclusive Kombo Audio development & Design Hub. 

Through this hub, we will be interacting with you (Backers), for feedback on the product decisions, new product ideas & input on functionality - both for current and future products. 

Special Offers
Beyond the reduced product price on Kickstarter, early KS backers will get Early access, and special offers on all new product launches. 

Early Delivery
We have secured stock for the first 150 bundles, which will all be reserved for Kickstarter backers. Unfortunately, any order beyond the first 150 bundles will experience delays due to the current global part shortage. Early Kickstarter backers will therefore get the product in their hands much earlier than anyone else. 





The Kombo system is designed with modularity in mind. We will therefore, post launch, be launching a wide range of new modules - each of which enables you to do more with live music, with less complexity.

These products are currently not under development, but are in the pipeline - and will be designed in collaboration with the KOMBO Development Hub community. 

Recording Module
We want to create an easy to use recording / looper module, which enables users to record their live performances through the Li-Sound interface, and instantly stream these through a smartphone. The estimated launch time for this product is 2024.

Module With VST support
Another pipelined product is a VST connected module, through which users can add effects, and and adjusts these easily through a VST converter. The estimated launch time for this product is 2024.




















 We are a small startup based in Denmark, consisting of musicians and engineers, developing an audio system for Live concerts & performances. Our focus is to bring innovative solutions to the Audio and Music market, and simplify the use of complex audio technology.













Snapshot of some of the programs Kombo Audio has participated in.



The Kombo Audio Team has been selected to participate in some of the most prestigious accelerator & incubator programs that Denmark has to offer. 
Kombo is currently participating in the biggest accelerator program, Danish Tech challenge, which hosts the most promising startups across the nation. 
Additionally, the team is located in the Danish Technical University`s campus with access to absolute world class facilities & experts in the acoustic industry.





Here are some of the beautiful moments from Kombo Audios development story.



Moments from the Kombo Sound system development process


Early revision of the String Instrument package: 






You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.





Play

































Replay with sound









Play with  sound












00:00


00:00































Please note that all items shown throughout the campaign are prototypes. The shipped version will be manufactured & assembled with high precision methods. 





We are expecting the shipping of the product to begin in June 2022. We will make frequent updates here on Kickstarter to let you know how our process is going and when you can expect delivery. 





Because of the chip shortage, the shipping will be split into two batches. The first 150 bundles' (Pompeii counts as 3, Central Park counts as 2 bundles, Folsom as 1) shipping will begin in June 2022 and for the remaining, we start the manufacturing right after the critical components are secured.
Please be aware that we don’t ship worldwide but only across EU, UK, US and Canada.
The estimated shipping cost of Folsom ‘68 is around 100 USD which will be charged in the Pledge manager after the end of the campaign. This is a good estimation about what you can expect.
The final shipping cost depends on the content of your reward and considering the fluctuation of the current shipping costs, it may vary.
                                   We will cover part of the shipping cost and the fluctuations, but the amount we can cover depends on the success of the campaign and how much the shipping costs will change over time.










We are committed to providing the best possible customer service and have designed the product to achieve high serviceability.
We offer basic service on all devices shipped and are more than happy to help you with problems you may have with your device. However, we cannot offer full refund service.
Additionally, we are strong supporters of the “Right to repair” movement, and as a result, all parts are designed to be repairable by you as the user - and we are committed to supplying any required spare parts. Any user-repair will however void any warranty we might provide.
As for a legal warranty, we must refer to the Kickstarter FAQ sections: "Kickstarter is not a store or a retailer. When you back a project, you enable us to create something new — not ordering something that already exists." These rewards are referred to as gifts as a token for our appreciation of your input & investment in our company, for which we are eternally grateful.

































The Kombo System (Recording of the Kombo speaker, with Module)
Kombo speaker with String instrument package - Guitar setting



Kombo speaker with String instrument package - Bass setting



Kombo speaker with String instrument package - Acoustic guitar setting




The KOMBO SYSTEM simulation & effects (Build Into Modules)
Sample reference without processing, electric guitar



Kombo string instrument package - Amp & Reverb, electric guitar



Sample reference without processing, electric bass

record.Creator: Shaperoo
record.Title: SHAPEROO 2025
record.Text:
The prototype of CNC Shaperoo 2025 was created as a successor to the Chinese CNC 3018 platform. The design was based on the assumption that the machine would have a similar workspace, but with significantly better rigidity, machining speed performance, and adjustable power of the AC-powered spindle. In short, the enormous power of a real milling machine was enclosed in a compact housing that fits on a workbench.





BEGINNERS 
If you are new to milling, it is not a problem because the assembly of the machine is easy and you will be assisted by our instructional videos. They will guide you from folding, through setup, to running the machine and processing material.
ADVANCED
Shaperoo is also designed for users who require precision machining. This is ensured by a rigid frame, refined and dedicated electronics, and years of our experience in designing and building CNC machines. 





CNC machines, as well as 3D printers, provide many possibilities for creation. Compared to similarly priced machines, Shaperoo is extremely powerful and precise. 

For this reason, the CNC is the ideal machine for the do-it-yourselfer and the person who likes DIY. You can see examples of very simple DIY works in our videos.






You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.





Play

































Replay with sound









Play with  sound












00:00


00:00










































You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.





Play

































Replay with sound









Play with  sound












00:00


00:00

































Engraving and cutting aluminium is also no problem for our machine.



Process of milling alluminium 6061








More advanced DIY and electronics enthusiasts may be interested in creating PCBs, for which our machine is also very well suited.



Process of milling PCB's





Sample of circiut made by Shaperoo2025







CNC system board based on Arduino nano 328, compatible with GRBL 1.1 and Estlcam.

  The board allows to control CNC machines using GRBL, Estlcam, or Chilipeppr firmware. Optically isolated inputs and outputs provide overvoltage protection on Arduino module ports while ensuring stable operation.
In addition to the typical leads for the GRBL, the laser, air assist, and PWM 0-10V connectors were also brought out. All three axes operate with backlash-canceling trapezoidal screws, allowing precise milling of even such complex tasks as circuit boards. 



Main Board by Shaperoo










Stepper Board by Shaperoo












Yes, it is possible! Thanks to a dedicated speed controller designed and manufactured by us, it is possible to adjust the spindle speed in the range of 10 000 - 20 000 RPM directly from control software (GRBL Candle, Estlcam).



AC PWM Controller by Shaperoo












Thanks to the measuring functions built into the software, it is possible to measure the surface and angular displacement of the workpiece.This functionality is particularly useful when milling PCBs, providing a constant cavity, eliminating surface irregularities.








Tool lenght measurment







The Estlcam software allows you to control the machine from a PC. Using its full potential, we have added a remote control to the machine to facilitate precise guidance of the spindle to the start position.















Years of experience in working with CNC machines allowed us to design a device that is easy to assembly, affordable but still very accurate. 
The base of the construction is made of L-type aluminum profiles, which provide rigidity to the whole machine. . Structural elements are made in 3D printing technology, with gyroid filling no less than 50%. As a result, we deliver high-quality and durability elements.















Unlike most CNC's, the Shaperoo has a shielded work area so 95% of the chips stay inside, this allows for a safer and cleaner work area. In case of an emergency there is an emergency stop button on the front of the machine.



Shaperoo2025 has protective glass.







It's been a while since we started working on our machine. Shaperoo 2025 is still a prototype, but the progress that has been made since the first version is enormous. The biggest achievements of this work are the development of our own controller boards, spindle PWM, tool length measurement and table mapping. In the future we plan to develop an attachable laser and we are open to suggestions. 



Prototype of Shaperoo 2025 





Final version

















 On Shaperoo you will be able to process:

MDF
HDF
Wood
Plywood
Plexi ( PMMA )
Glass laminate ( PCB )
Rubber
PVC
Acrylic 

Here are sample processing parameters on our machine:

 Wood:
                   Feed rate: 800 to 1200mm/min
                   Depth of cut: 1.5 to 2 mm
 6061 Aluminum:   
                   Feed rate: 800 to 1200mm/min
                   Depth of cut: 0.08 to 0.1 mm
 Acrylic:
                   Feed rate: 500 to 1000mm/min
                   Depth of cut: 1 to 1.5 mm
 PVC:
                   Feed rate: 800 to 1200
                   Depth of cut: 1.5mm to 2mm












We ship Shaperoo 2025 kits worldwide, but please note that the machine is designed to be plugged into 230V 50Hz mains. US version is planned for the future.
Shipping to Poland is 20€, rest of the world 30€.





You can find us on Facebook, Instagram, and Youtube! We have also a website: https://shaperoo.com























Tomasz Matuszewski – project founder and lead designer  
Julia Matuszewska - photographer
Sara Matuszewska – lead assembly
Sylwia Matuszewska – logistician
Piotr Pawlik – lead electrician
Marek Kornaś – lead PCB designer
Paweł Cyrankowski - marketing strategist

record.Creator: Wild Streets
record.Title: Wild Streets - Green Your City With Augmented Reality
record.Text:
Wild Streets is a free augmented reality app that combines scientific data and high-quality 3D models of trees and plants to allow people to co-create the green, inclusive cities of tomorrow. More than ever, we need cities that offer green, healthy, usable spaces from micro parks sprinkled across neighbourhoods to green high-streets and super bicycle pathways connecting every corner of a city - and they ought to be shaped by the people they are intended for. Wild Streets is a tool that will help people reimagine their cities. It celebrates people’s differences and enables place-makers in creating spaces that unify and incorporates the needs and wishes of all. The app takes public engagement and awareness building on the benefits of urban nature to a whole new level.
At the same time, Wild Streets harnesses the power of aggregated social data to inform decision-makers and planners about locals' preferences for green infrastructure - putting citizens at the centre of urban development. Limits to funding, awareness, and time are interrelated factors that compromise the quality of urban greening as they impede the decision-making of everyone involved. Wild Streets offers a cost- and time-effective tool that enables municipalities, organisations, and companies of all budgets to meet citizens at street level.   





It's an ambitious project. That's why we've teamed up with two award-winning companies, Norgram and Set Snail, who have the expertise needed to bring the Wild Streets vision to life. We're also proud to be joining forces with i-Tree and Treeconomics, both drivers in the UK and internationally of the study of the multi-dimensional benefits of urban trees. To ensure that the app and our services are designed in a way that enables us to meet our objectives, we've assembled three incredible subject-focused advisory boards. A supervisory board will help us grow our geographical reach and scope in an organic and sustainable man





Wild Streets is a not-for-profit association registered in Denmark (CVR no. 39872595). 
Empowering People to Green the Urban Landscape
Imagine if you could adapt your city right here and now; if those dull, grey streets could be your canvas. The work commute could be as pleasant as a walk in the park. Your surroundings could be tailored to suit your everyday needs for places to take a break, eat that lunch, let the kids roam around safely, and exercise in a calm setting with cleaner, healthier air. Those familiar spaces could look and feel like they never have before.
Using Apple's augmented reality technology, the Wild Streets app will blur the line between how our cities are and what could be. We're inviting you to green your streets, squares, bike paths, back alleys, rooftops, and every other little opportune corner of your city, with lush, beautiful 3D vector trees and plants.
Besides having fun creating the city of your dreams, we want you to share it with the world. Wild Streets allows other people to step into your ideas by letting them reload your green creation at the same location, comment on it, iterate on the design, and share it with even more people including those in a position to make it happen. By including users' social data, we are also bridging the gap between locals, those who design our public spaces, and those who have the final say about their development. No more publicly displayed still images showing picture-perfect renders of urban landscapes nobody had a say on: planners will be able to see what people really want - across genders, ages, ethnicity - and people will be able to take official proposals to the test in the real-time world.
Welcome to the green, inclusive cities of tomorrow!





 Why Wild Streets? 
If we can harness our collective imagination and show it to the world, we don't need to accept the way things are, or even tweak the details. It's high time for a step-change into the future we want to live in. How green could your city be, how would it feel to think of streets as parks, how would it change the way you and your family live now and into a climate uncertain future?
In 2020, the world as we know it changed for most of us. It got a lot smaller in many ways, and we have been forced to interact differently with our surroundings. The quality of our neighborhoods, access to nature, and the feeling of a space have all proven to be critical factors to people's mental and physical health in a time where lockdowns have mainly kept us at home or in our immediate surroundings.
As we gradually adapt to new normals and return to old ones, these factors are likely to play a big role in how we perceive and make use of our cities. It has become clear that (nearby) access to green space for exercise, social gathering, and quiet self-reflection is scarce at best. And the design of such spaces is narrow and not accommodating the needs of everyone. People's awareness of the quality of the air they breathe has also come into focus, or there is at least ample opportunity to instill it.
Allowing locals to shape their neighbourhoods and the places they work and play according to their needs is perhaps more than ever a timely opportunity to shape inclusive, considered cities. With the significant loss of power that people have experienced over their everyday life in 2020, there is a new willingness to take part in the reshaping of urban spaces - co-creation has the potential to empower people to take control of this process.
The current crisis has amplified the reasons why the design of our cities is not fit to deal with what remains one of the greatest challenges of our time. Climate change has a visible impact on our lives, with urban temperatures fluctuating between extremes and nature in an unprecedented decline. Many cities are hotspots of biodiversity and use natural solutions to keep cool, prevent floods, deflect pollution, and calm winds. Today, nine in ten people worldwide live in places where air pollution levels exceed guideline limits by the World Health Organization, causing more than 7 million deaths every year. With the world’s urban population continuing its rapid climb to 68 percent by 2050, the transformation towards green, low-carbon cities is critical.
Urban forests and nature in general, play a pivotal role in this, but current planting efforts in many cities are not happening at the rate they could. Wherever people have been given a voice in planning their city through measures such as participatory budgeting, there has been a clear call for greener surroundings. These can't be only top-down decisions either, the people who live in and use the streets every day need to have a say, and have a sense of ownership over what for some is their garden. There is an urgent need for solutions that enable the co-creation of tomorrow’s sustainable, green cities in the image of the people that inhabits them and that supports the rising willingness and activism among citizens to help bring about this transition. To that willingness, we offer Wild Streets.
How it works
Utilising the revolutionary possibilities of AR (augmented reality), Wild Streets will enable users to green any location in real-time with simple drag’n’drop of true-to-scale 3D plants, trees, and street fixtures to whatever surroundings they view through their mobile device. Just like other AR apps, Wild Streets will measure relative heights, depths, and distances, presenting users with realistic limitations to where items can be placed. Ultimately, Wild Streets will allow users to experience their own and others' green designs, take selfies of themselves in it and share it with the world on social media.  






You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.





Play

































Replay with sound









Play with  sound












00:00


00:00































The functionalities of Wild Streets are straightforward! The following mock-ups are concept sketches of the app's design that help us communicate the project with knowledge partners, advisory board members, and our B2B network. The final UI and UX designs will be developed by our talented development team and will look very different from these sketches, in terms of both visuals and wording, but this is how the concept works:



































We have made a prototype that demonstrates a simplified, raw version of the tree-placing functionality, how detailed the 3D vector trees are, and how easily one can reimagine any space. However, it is but a proof-of-principle prototype, and the full version of the app will look and feel completely different both in terms of design and the resolution and detailing of the trees, and feature many additional functionalities.






You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.





Play

































Replay with sound









Play with  sound












00:00


00:00































 A stunning visual experience
To give users the most realistic experience, we'll be working with the award-winning vegetation software of Speedtree to create 3D trees and plants vectors. Think Avatar and Star Wars and their incredible landscapes, those are the quality of Speedtree's vector models! Using their software, we can model stunning, lifelike trees and plants as it taps into substantive databases of textures, enables the configuration of species-specific characteristics such as leaves, flowers, seeds, height, spread, branch length, branching angles, and bark texture. It is also possible to change the season, add wind effects as well as directional lighting on leaves and the tree surface. Believe us, it's immersive - you'll find yourself trying to touch the trees! 





Other elements for placemaking
Taking a stroll in a green space is lovely, but placing a bench amongst it would open up loads of new ways to spend time there. It's not surprising that greenery and street fixtures are closely related design parameters for urban planning. The selection of greenery for a location may very well depend on its intended purpose and hence any placed furniture and fixtures.
In general, preferences to street fixtures vary substantially across demographic groups and life situations; elderly are likely to need more comfortable seating compared to children who generally want something fun to play on! Including street furniture in the app enables considered placemaking - and will help planners understand what people need and want and from their city.
This is why we'll be continuously collaborating with environmentally conscious producers of seriously smart (and stylish!) solutions for outdoor benches, cycle parking, street separators, playground- and sports facilities, and other elements that just make a city work better. We will have the same high requirements for the visual quality of the 3D models of these products as we do for our tree and plant vectors.  





 Where to use it
The more we speak to people about Wild Streets, the more potential opportunities come up for things it makes possible. Organisations representing a wide range of urban interests, along with councils and companies in the business of placemaking are keen to use Wild Streets to create awareness about their work and to help them achieve their goals. Here're just a few examples of uses of the app:





Powered by data
What makes Wild Streets so powerful - and ambitious! - is its usage of high-quality, and to the extent possible, real-time data. The app uses locally sourced data to make geo-specific recommendations for greenery that will thrive based on climate and ecology. Why does that matter? While it's clear that mango trees won't be too happy in the cold Scandinavian winter, it may surprise you to know to what extent choosing the right tree for the right place can have huge beneficial impacts on your neighbourhood. Research shows that trees have the ability to significantly reduce the risk of flooding, improve air quality, bring back wildlife, grow food, increase the amenity value, reduce temperature extremes and help people cope with stress - just to mention a few amazing features. 
Our demands to the data we use are critical for the overall usability of the app, for making it a trustworthy source for councils and place makers, and what distinguishes it from gimmicky AR apps. At launch, the algorithm powering the Wild Streets app will feature a selection of carefully considered indicators from well renowned and trusted data sources to suggest the right trees for the right place. We have prioritised these indicators based on in-depth conversations with foresters and researchers. Over time, we aspire to expand our algorithm with indicators expressive of more structurally complicated site-specific conditions as well as estimated benefits from tree planting.

























It's all about communication
Creating awareness
Our algorithm will be hard at work in the background, processing thousands of data entries, while leaving you to play and have fun designing your city. We know from experience that communicating knowledge on sustainability is an incredibly hard task; the issues are complex and their implications are difficult to cope with. If we were to present people with technical information on all of the specific challenges and conditions of a location that they're thinking about greening, we'd lose 95 percent of them. And we want to get everybody excited and involved in greening up their cities! 
Key to the development of the Wild Streets app has therefore been to understand what tickles people when it comes to urban placemaking, and to partner up with the best strategic design team out there. With a laser focus on engagement, Wild Streets will seamlessly navigate users through the human and ecological benefits of their amazing designs. Of course, there will also be opt-in options for more detailed information for users who are interested. 
Managing expectations
Through our many conversations with people in the urban planning field, it has become clear that an integrated in-app measure is needed to cope with people's expectations of a design created with Wild Streets. Because the reality is that the app and its data do not offer a blueprint for what is actually possible without the consideration of an experienced forester, and no matter how wonderful a design turns out and how many likes it gets on social media, no one is obligated to make it happen. That said, seeing is believing, and Wild Streets brings ideas so much closer to reality.
Wild Streets uses the best available data to present users with flora that are likely to suit local site conditions and help tackle local challenges. We are developing a 'Confidence Index' that will give a transparent picture of the availability and quality of data for any given location. Through this index, we are also hoping to encourage more data collection and entrepreneurship. 
Design campaigns
Design campaigns are tailored, in-app areas made for design surveys of specific geographical locations, and with respect to special social and/or environmental concerns. In a nutshell, design campaigns invite the public to have a direct say in current/ongoing greening projects. They feature tailored pop-up messages, surveys, and optimised tree/plant bundles for a specific theme. Actually, there will be many more available features and we'll keep adding more as we go!
This feature of the app has been designed with councils, architects, and developers in mind to do good public engagement for local greening and building projects from the hyper-local level to master-planning. Users will be able to have a say on what they would like to have featured in an area, and respond to and iterate upon design proposals right at the beginning of the process.
A campaign can have multiple rounds of engagement! For example, citizens can be asked to provide general ideas for a place or give feedback on pre-commissioned landscape design, then once all that feedback has been digested by planners, citizens can have another go on an optimised design. In this way, you increase people's sense of ownership of a place and the quality of the result. People are likely to be more committed to the process, and in using and looking after the place which is created as a result. 





 Expect a lot of augmented reality fun with app-wide global campaigns as well, where we will focus on international awareness days celebrating nature, climate, biodiversity, urbanism, sports as well as physical and mental health. You will never know what surprises we might let loose when placing a tree!
So what happens to people's designs?
As important and powerful as the engagement and awareness experience is from just using the app, the true value of Wild Streets is in the data it collects and the output it generates. We want people's beautiful designs and ideas for their cities to go somewhere where change can happen. Based on the conversations we've had with many future users, we're launching the app with different outputs tailored to citizens and to clients (municipalities, organisations, companies). 
Visual outputs
Citizens
The visual output available to people will be fairly simple as their interest mainly is in experiencing their own and other users' designs in real-time and in formats commonly shared on social media. By enabling people to share high-quality videos or photos ('selfie' or not), it inspires others to have a say. This raises the bar of ambition for decision-makers, and having seen what people need and want, there is a public accountability to use that knowledge and make ideas come to life. It changes the conversation between citizens and councils from opposition to proposition, to help make supporting voices as loud as protesting ones are today. 
Clients
Clients as a group have more differing needs in the formats they access and review users' design submissions in, depending on their profession. How clients can explore the app's output matters a great deal to the potential societal impact of Wild Streets. The diagram below illustrates the various types of visual output formats that future users have expressed interest in. Clients also get access to a dashboard through which they can receive your designs, showing what green space the people want and where, and how much value all the ideas would bring if they were made. 
Shared designs and some basic aggregated info about the characteristics of the people who made them give organisations and councils everywhere a really useful database to make better decisions about green spaces for a particular community. So that even if there are few designs shared in a particular place or project, designers might know, for example, that people of a certain sort of age, ethnicity, and gender tend to prefer spaces that feel safe, smell and look beautiful, have playgrounds, and have amazing green pathways for sports.





Data output 
Citizens & clients
The data output presented to the users is carefully chosen to be engaging but not to overwhelm and risk that they don't complete a design or delete the app. The app will suggest other local designs for the user to explore based not only on geographic location but also on shared social characteristics, building a local awareness of what the community wants. For awareness-raising and engagement, the app will feature estimated values of the ecosystem services delivered by the design.
Clients
Alongside the visual design recommendations from users, Wild Streets will also generate data useful to clients. These include the ecosystem services of a user's designs and the cumulative effect of these for a defined geographic area.
The app collects demographic data on age, gender, nationality, ethnicity, location, and whether people have children or live with handicaps. By cross-referencing preferences for greenery; such as formality, naturalism, species choice, or functionality with information about the types of users that preferred them, a designer/planner can better cater to the needs of different communities or types of individuals.
Such data will be available in aggregated form to allow clients to see whether a survey campaign has been inclusive or reached the desired demographic groups. Naturally, data protection and privacy are key, and users' personal information will be protected.





It's gonna be a learning curve, for sure, as to what kind of output people need to make Wild Streets serve them best. Luckily, the app collects plenty of data behind the scenes that we can use to continuously create new exiting outputs to accommodate people's wishes
Wild Streets as a facilitator for urban greening
Irrespective of your motivations for using the app, we will do everything we can to help make citizens' visions come true. Not only does anyone working in not-for-profit placemaking have free, unlimited access to citizens' designs, but the real magic is unlocked when they can see what sort of people make what sort of designs (free as well!). That's the foundation for inclusive placemaking. A lot of effort will be put into distributing these insights and visuals to our growing international network of councils and organisations enabling them to make considered decisions. 
And don't worry, we take privacy very seriously.   
 Inviting our community to shape the app 
It is thanks to in-depth conversations with placemakers from councils, interested organisations, and companies - the people who work on the ground and directly with citizens on greening our cities - that Wild Streets looks the way it does today. Going forward, it makes sense to us that those who are going to apply the app also should have a strong say on what it has to offer. We are inviting our community of placemakers to co-create the app and the complementing services, be part of beta-testing, and have a real impact on the product development process. We believe this will increase the chances for citizens' designs to be realised.
Where will the app be available?
Wild Streets will be globally available from its release day. However, it is planned to officially launch in the UK where the concept was born with the most complete data, most tree species, the highest confidence index and many partnerships for data, grassroots engagement, and professional deployment. A soft launch will follow shortly after in a select city in the US. These locations will have the highest 'Confidence Index' (data coverage and quality) and hence see a higher accuracy of the app's tree-selection tool and ecosystem benefit calculations. As one example: while the app is powered with global air quality data from Plume Labs, a recognised global data provider, UK/US data authorities will provide more precise local information.
The implications for the app's usability elsewhere straight after launch depend on whether or not a country belongs to the same 'world climate region' as the UK - the light green area in the map below. These areas stand a good chance of being hospitable to the initial set of trees, though those species might not be the most obvious choices for the local ecology.





While our global data providers feed the app with location-specific information, certain assumptions will be made for countries belonging to the UK's 'cool temperate moist' region. We may also be able to make certain assumptions for other regions with similar hardiness characteristics. This will be decided following advice from our Scientific Advisory Board and Knowledge Partners.
Any country belonging to the other world climate regions will see a lower Confidence Index and will still be able to access a selection of tree species that are known to those regions. However, the selection tool will not be 'active' as data coverage is simply too low to make an informed recommendation. For these countries, Wild Streets will, nevertheless, still be a powerful engagement and placemaking tool.





...and when? 
We have defined 1 year from funding being secured until the fully tested app is ready for release. In the testing stages, councils, companies, and organizations in our network will get the chance to apply Wild Streets in real life and help us perfect the app. Do you want to get your hands on the beta-version too? Sign up for our newsletter here. 





Budget
Wild Streets is an ambitious project using some of the best people in their fields - as you might have suspected by now, it is not possible to develop a full-scale version of the app for just €50.000. In fact, the whole project is estimated to cost €1.628.000. These numbers have been subject to countless revisions as we have optimized our MVP (minimum viable product), giving enough space for our team of developers to work with Apple and our knowledge/data providers to get the app working flawlessly. Here's how we'll spend the money: 





With your help, we can get the work started and get the funding ball rolling. Once you pledge, you'll be invited to join a Substack space, where we'll share exclusive behind-the-scenes videos from the developers' desk, live streams with the Wild Streets team, and other goodies including future features that we're currently keeping under wraps. You'll also get a real say in the development of the app from day 1 through polls and demos. This is a tool for co-design, and we'll be co-designing the app itself too.
For every stretch goal we reach, we'll make additional features available or enhance existing ones - available at launch or within 1 year thereof.  Once we've reached Goal 10, we'll announce additional goals and the exciting features they come with.  










In addition to Kickstarter, we're also pursuing large sponsors to meet the full funding we need to create and launch. We will keep you updated on our funding progress outside Kickstarter, so you can how close we are to our goals.
What if we collect more than we need? 
The more funding we get, the more we have to develop additional features and services to kick Wild Streets off with and to plan amazing launch events with. Wild Streets is a not-for-profit organization and everything we earn will be funneled into enhancing the user experience, our offerings to placemakers, and launching full data versions of the app in other countries.      
The rewards
When pledging to Wild Streets, you are pledging towards your future. Our Kickstarter rewards are all connected to the Wild Streets app, meaning by default that no rewards become available before the full app is fully financed and developed. But when it is ready, there will be a treasure chest of rewards. 
Below you will see the rewards available - once you make a pledge, we invite you to become a lifetime member of our community, meaning that you will get early access to new releases, pre-sets, fun filters and animated hidden surprises, green-screen persona appearances (oh yes!), and many more engaging surprises. We will also share exclusive behind-the-scenes and making-of videos during the development of the app. 










Head to our website at www.wildstreets.org if you're interested in a personalised reward or already have an idea for a green commissioned project.
So who are we
We are currently a small team of two but it feels like we are many more because of our committed network and advisors with huge collective experience and wisdom between them. Once our budget is secured, our team will grow to five as we will need an innovative developer who can continue the product development, a data-wizard, and a social media/PR whirlwind fluent in engagement.





Contact  
Something that does not make sense? Or simply curious to know more? Maybe you (and your neighborhood) want to be part of the beta-testing community, or you're sitting on data that could benefit the app? Or maybe you have a specific idea for collaboration.
Feel free to reach out to us with any inquiry - big or small - by writing us at founder@wildstreets.org or calling us at +45 31 20 74 90.

record.Creator: Spiridon Sapouridis
record.Title: ServiceAtHome: Die App welche Dienstleistungen digitslisiert
record.Text:
Hello people, wir wollen den gesamten dritten Wirtschaftssektor digitalisieren. Was bedeutet das? Nun, Deutschland ist ein Land, welches von Dienstleistungen geprägt ist; beim Friseurbesuch, im Nagelstudio, in einer Therme, in einer Sauna oder beim Handwerker, alles sind Dienstleistungen.  Um diese Dienstleistungen und viele mehr in Anspruch zu nehmen, wird oft ein Termin benötigt, welcher nach wie vor noch überwiegend am Telefon vereinbart wird und dieses Vorgehen kostet Zeit, Geld und kann die Qualität der Dienstleistung mindern. Mit unserer App soll sich das ändern!
Laut einer Umfrage, welche von der Forsa durchgeführt wurde, warten viele Menschen in Deutschland nur darauf, Dienstleistungen im Internet zu buchen. Wir haben dafür eine Marktplatz-Lösung entwickelt, welche dies ermöglichen soll und auf vollständiger Transparenz basiert. Der Kunde kann sich jedes Angebot, von jedem Dienstleister und mit allen Extras anschauen und vergleichen, bis er das richtige Angebot gefunden hat. Der Dienstleister hingegen hat nur einen monatlichen Festpreis zu zahlen und braucht somit keine Angst vor versteckten Mehrkosten haben und kann die Preise im Internet genau so anbieten wie vor Ort. Hinzu kommt, dass wir die wichtigsten drei Aspekte, welche sich die befragten gewünscht umgesetzt haben, diese sind: 
1.  Die Kunden wünschen sich eine hohe Überschaubarkeit: ServiceAtHome bietet durch seinen Aufbau eine fast intuitive Nutzung sodass unser Marktplatz für Dienstleistungen einem Marktplatz für Produkte gleicht.
2. An zweiter Stelle ist die durchgängige Erreichbarkeit des Marktplatzes und die 24/7-Möglichkeit der Terminbuchung gefordert. ServiceAtHome ist durch seine online Präsenz immer erreichbar und selbst bei Störungen oder anbahnenden Störungen sind bereits Alternativen vorbereitet und werden für eine gute Erreichbarkeit der Seite eingesetzt.
3. Die drittstärkste Forderung von Kunden ist, dass eine Terminbuchung online Zeit spart im Vergleich zu den üblichen oft genutzten Telefonen. ServiceAtHome ermöglicht einen Termin zu buchen in nur wenigen Klicks. Die Terminbestätigung erhält sowohl der Kunde als auch der Dienstleister direkt nach der Bezahlung.

Mit der neuen App können wir alle Aspekte und noch vieles mehr noch besser umsetzen. So wird auch eine Integrierung des Termins in einem digitalen Kalender eines Drittanbieters, von Kunden als Pluspunkt gesehen, was ebenfalls eingebaut werden soll.
Der nächste positive Effekt, welcher entsteht, ist der, dass bei vielen kleineren Dienstleistern der Arbeitsprozess durch ein Telefonklingeln gestört wird. Mit unserer App kann man sich voll und ganz auf den Kunden konzentrieren und die höchste Qualität erbringen. 
Abschließend wollen wir auch die Werbung und das Marketing der Dienstleister übernehmen und das "zusammen" machen. So wollen wir verschiedene Dienstleister in Marketing-Kampagnen von ServiceAtHome integrieren und z.B. mit den Dienstleistern auf Social Media auftreten oder Plakatwerbung betreiben.

record.Title: Where? CatchApp - Let's meet here!
record.Text:
Where? CatchApp, is an APP designed to solve the problem of the "optimal point to meet".





It is able to find the optimal point between an unlimited number of people, the ideal meeting point for companies of friends, associations, or colleagues (organize company meetings, bring together scout groups, biker groups, camper friends, etc.).





It helps to decide the choice of activities closest to the meeting place (restaurants, pizzerias, bars, discos, museums, cinemas, but also soccer fields, camping areas or other) and, if you want, make a reservation.
